ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I know more about the universe and the planets, and I also learn a lot of useful knowledge to deal with practical problems. By participanting the solar observation held by the instructor and the teaching assistants, I see the sunspots for the first time and was totally impressed by the delicate telescope!
Early cosmology, stellar properties & evolution, modern cosmology, black holes, etc

I believe that the skills I gained were primarily in solving the problems that involved calculation, I gained better understanding of different concepts of physics which I had not previously learnt about, such as Kepler's laws and relativity. I gained a lot of knowledge on astronomical phenomena, which I thought was fascinating.
Math
I gained an understanding of how the universe was formed and how it evolves, as well as the different galactic bodies in the universe.
Basic understanding about cosmology and lots of knowledge about the universe. Lots of cool theories and ideas.

Astrophysics basics. 
For example, ideas about the Big Bang Theory and evolution of the galaxies.
The movement of celestial bodies, their evolution and the development of space-time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There are weekly quizzes for the course so it is helpful for us to review the content leanred, the instructor will take us to observe the Sun using telescope  and to the observatory to see the night sky. I do admire the practical part of the course because it is hard for me, a not astronomical major student to have those chances. However, because we have to attend the class everyday, so the workload may be too much to handle with two homework each contains 20-40 calcutating problems, and I do spend a lot of time doing the homework.

Strengths: professor zinn, the ta's, problem sets were the right level of difficulty to help with quizzes and exam but they were definitely do-able
Weaknesses: i think posting the lectures for class beforehand would help students prepare questions they might have

The course was engaging and interesting, a lot of content is taught in the span of 5-weeks. The trip to the observatory was a great opportunity to really get to see the astronomical objects. However, I believe the course would improve it is was more interactive.
This course had a clear structure and a good pace. It could have been improved if the slides were posted slightly earlier.

My strengths are calculation and analysis.
My weakness is remembering all those cosmology parts.
I would hope the final evaluation to be more than an exam, such as a project on specific topics.

Pros: covers a wide and deep range of knowledge.
Cons: Less connected to the real world.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I will definitely recommend the course. Actually I've already recommended it to my friends and they are all interested in it. As I mentioned above, it is hard for us to get the chance to see the telescope and go to the observatory, so the practical teaching mode of the instructor makes it possible for everyone to experience the beauty of the sky. Meanwhile, the instructor and teaching assistants are all friendly, they are warm-hearted to answer questions and offer helps. Also the content of the course is absolutely suitable for students who are keen on astronomy but do not major in it, since it offers much basic and general information to lead us into the gate.
Yes! Great science class! This was my favorite class that I took for a distributional requirement. The professor and TA's are amazing also.
Yes. I would recommend to students who have little understanding of astronomy, as it is an introductory course.
This course is an interesting course, but keep in mind that Astronomy courses are just Math courses.

I would recommend it to another student if they were interested in learning more about astronomy, but weren't interested in math or physics. It provided a good overview of what the universe is made up of, but the math was very basic and a lot of time was spent on it.
Yes. if he or she is also interested in physics and astronomy, I will recommend this course. It is fascinating.
Yes. This course covers a large amount of knowledge and is ideal for students with an interest in astronomy. However, this course requires a high level of math and physics as a foundation.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: Although I do not major in astronomy, I think I will keep reading books or documentaries about astronomy in the future, and it will be helpful to use those skills learned in the course to better interpret the information in the professional books.
I like how organized and clear the pace and topics of the class were. I hope to use some of the study methods I used here in classes for my major!
I think mainly the skills that I got in physics will help me, as I'm interested in majoring in engineering in the future.

As someone who isn't necessarily looking to continue studying astronomy, I will use the knowledge I learned in this course to understand more what I'm looking at when I look at stars and just have background knowledge about our universe.
Maybe I will choose astronomy as my graduate major. It is always fun to learn some physics.

I'm conducting a research on black holes and dark energy, and cosmological coupling right now. The knowledge from the course greatly help me to have better comprehension of lots of concepts.
I would major in astrophysics in college.

With the advancement of technology, mankind will go farther in the universe and the knowledge of astronomy will profoundly affect every aspect of people's lives. In the future, I will take astronomy as a subject of my own study, and through learning the laws of the universe, I will master the methods that allow human beings to progress.

extras.title: ASTR S120 01 - Galaxies and the Universe
